body:
Comment 10 by **nicolashillegeer**: 
> The MOVSB instead of MOVSQ is faster, but not as fast as SSE.  And it still has a
large startup cost which makes it impractical for small sizes.

Thanks for trying it out. Since I don't have an Ivy Bridge or newer myself, I couldn't
know for sure. I had almost expected it to be just as fast as the SSE-based copy (also
with less startup cost), but it seems like heavily switched memcpy's will still be
necessary for the foreseeable future. I guess I had assumed that the REP instructions
had finally started doing what they were meant to do (efficiently).
